answers.answer: Most drs won't allow you to elect a csection. Usually its only done if there's a medical reason for it.

Most likely if there is NOTHING wrong with you & you have never had one before they will not perform this procedure on you . Now someone like me that has had this previous surgery done due to me having Preeclampsia, I had to have an cesarean. So , that gave me a better chance of having one this time if I want to . But I told my doctor that I am going to try a Vbac & see how far I dialate . . . If not then there will be a surgeon waiting for me(: i'm excited!

I can guarantee you don't want a c section. You know they are a major surgery right? Minimum recovery time 6-8 weeks. I just had a c section 4 weeks ago and I can still barely move. Taking care of my newborn is challenging all or the time. I am in constant pain and have gotten an infection around my incision even though I took great care of my wound

my friends doctor gave her the option. for her first child she did it naturally and for her second child she did a c section.  she had no problems with her c section . both were healthy babies and all she said she had trouble with was a little pain recovering and staying in the hospital longer. alot of people will put their 2 cents in and call you selfish if you have a c section which in my opinion do what you please to with your child. im sure theres been cases. where something bad happened but thats just like everyone else. you could be the greatest mom ever but if you have a c section now your just selfish . lol goodluck beautiful!

I would say go natural. I just had an all natural birth last Saturday 3 hours after birth I was up and that only because I was doing skin to skin those few hours. I left the hospital the next day and the day after that I was already up and out doing stuff. My first sons birthday party is today so I've been running errands all week with my new born and I feel completely fine.
Girl natural!! Im praying to get have a natural delivery. There's a possibility im going to have a c section . Im terribly frightened!
You can do skin to skin after a c section. They will place the baby on your chest while you are being stitched up.

I probably HAVE 2 have a c section..and it makes me really sad...I wish I had the choice :/...u should have ur baby naturally if u ask me..c sections r major surgerys with lots of pain after and lots of recovery time that makes it hard 2 care for a new born....even tho it might seem easier as far as having thr baby goes..u lose the whole experience..and theres much more pain and recovering...but its ur choice...good luck
^^ I feel the same wasy @hellojojo I want to havemy baby natural so bad too!

& also , it's your choice ! Talk with your doctor , have a 1 on 1 with him/her & tell them how you feel . . . Don't listen to anyone & let them make you feel like going natural is whats best for your body . Nobody knows what your true reason is . . .

Strive to do it natural and talk to your doctor about options. C sections are a long time to recover and it is a major surgery. In my opinion they should only be done when it's medically necessary. I am not trying to be rude or offend anyone it's just my thoughts

Thank you for your opinions. Just getting an idea from those who have previous experience. There is so much to this and its very overwhelming especially since a) wasnt expecting this & b) was told I wouldnt be able to have kids a few years ago.

I would say go natural I just had my baby 5 days ago and I was up walking around yeah it hurts afterwards cause your so sore down there but I think you would hurt worse with your tummy because you can't really do much
I had a c section yesterday and I'm up walking around with little to No pain except the getting up and sitting down process. It was terrifying going in but once they were doing it I was fine.

Girl im going to be honest, you should go natural I made it to 9 1/2 cm and then found out my baby was breech. I have a Very High pain tolerance, that being said I had a c section. First I'll tell you my experience sucked everything was ripped away from me I couldn't hold the baby because you're strapped to a table, my husband couldn't cut the cord I didn't get that immediate son to son like I wanted. It was very hard I couldn't get in my bed (it was too high) I couldn't sit on my toilet to pee my husband had to help me get on and off showering was hard but needed to be done then when my husband went back to work i felt useless and lived off crackers and granola bars because I couldn't stand long enough to cook a whole meal. Then the first week past and I started pushing myself because there wasn't a lot of pain anymore and I wanted everything to be perfect and my stitches came back open... so my doc put me on bed rest which didn't stay bed rest but it was an awful experience... I am due in dec and I am praying for a vbac I want my "reward" after the rough 9 months. Sorry for such a long response but I don't know anyone who would opt for a c section unless its better for the baby. You could get an epidural if you want pain relief.

question: This will be my first, but im unsure if I want to have a normal delivery or if id prefer having a c section. Any suggestions or advice?
title: Natural or C section?
